content:
RelatedEnd Class

Definition

Represents a base class that implements common functionality for a related end.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract]
public abstract class RelatedEnd : System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IRelatedEnd
Inheritance
System.Object
RelatedEnd

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

RelatedEnd is the base class for the EntityCollection<TEntity> class and the EntityReference<TEntity> class.

The RelatedEnd class implements functionality that is shared between the EntityCollection<TEntity> and EntityReference<TEntity> classes.

This class is not intended to be used directly in your code.

Properties

IsLoaded

Gets a value that indicates whether all related objects have been loaded.

public bool IsLoaded { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the related end contains all the related objects from the database; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Calling the Load method sets the IsLoaded flag to true.

Calling the Clear method on an EntityCollection<TEntity> sets IsLoaded to false.

An EntityCollection<TEntity> or EntityReference<TEntity> may also be loaded if the related end is included in the query path. For more information about span, see Loading Related Objects.

The Load method on EntityCollection<TEntity> and EntityReference<TEntity> loads related objects from the data source whether or not IsLoaded is true.

When an object is detached, the IsLoaded flag is changed from false to true.

To guarantee that a related end is fully loaded before doing processing, you should check whether IsLoaded is false. If IsLoaded is false, you should call the Load method.

RelationshipName

Gets the name of the relationship in which this related end participates.

public string RelationshipName { get; }
Value
String

The name of the relationship in which this RelatedEnd participates. The relationship name is not namespace qualified.

RelationshipSet

Gets a reference to the metadata for the related end.

public System.Data.Metadata.Edm.RelationshipSet RelationshipSet { get; }
Value
RelationshipSet

A RelationshipSet object that contains metadata for the end of a relationship.

SourceRoleName

Gets the role name at the source end of the relationship.

public string SourceRoleName { get; }
Value
String

A String that is the role name.

Remarks

The role name is specified by the Role attribute of the End element in the association that defines this relationship in the conceptual model. For more information, see Association Element (CSDL).

TargetRoleName

Gets the role name at the target end of the relationship.

public string TargetRoleName { get; }
Value
String

A String that is the role name.

Remarks

The role name is specified by the Role attribute of the End element in the association that defines this relationship in the conceptual model. For more information, see Association Element (CSDL).

Methods

GetEnumerator()

Returns an IEnumerator that iterates through the collection of related objects.

public System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator

An IEnumerator that iterates through the collection of related objects.

Load()

When overridden in a derived class, loads the related object or objects into the related end with the default merge option.

public void Load ();
Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

When the source object was retrieved by using a MergeOption query and the MergeOption is not MergeOption or the related objects are already loaded.

-or-

When the source object is not attached to the ObjectContext.

-or-

When the source object is being tracked but is in the EntityState or EntityState state or the MergeOption used for Load is MergeOption.

Remarks

The default merge option is MergeOption for tracked objects or MergeOption when the object is not tracked in the ObjectStateManager. To specify a merge option other than MergeOption, call the Load method on the EntityCollection<TEntity> or the EntityReference<TEntity> that takes a specific MergeOption parameter.

Calling the Load method sets the IsLoaded flag to true.

The Load method loads related objects from the data source whether or not IsLoaded is true.

Load(MergeOption)

When overridden in a derived class, loads an object or objects from the related end with the specified merge option.

public abstract void Load (System.Data.Objects.MergeOption mergeOption);
mergeOption
MergeOption

The MergeOption to use when merging objects into an existing stem.Data.Objects.DataClasses.EntityCollection`1.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

When the source object was retrieved by using a MergeOption query and the MergeOption is not MergeOption or the related objects are already loaded.

-or-

When the source object is not attached to the ObjectContext.

-or-

When the source object is being tracked but is in the EntityState or EntityState state or the MergeOption used for stem.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelatedEnd.Load* is MergeOption.

Remarks

Both EntityCollection<TEntity> and EntityReference<TEntity> override this method to load related objects. Load is called to explicitly load related objects from a related end exposed by a navigation property. For more information, see Loading Related Objects.

Calling the Load method sets the IsLoaded flag to true.

The Load method loads related objects from the data source whether or not IsLoaded is true.

The default merge option is MergeOption for tracked objects or MergeOption when the object is not tracked in the ObjectStateManager.

OnDeserialized(StreamingContext)

Used internally to deserialize entity objects along with the RelationshipManager instances.

public void OnDeserialized (System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context);
context
StreamingContext

The serialized stream.

Events

AssociationChanged

Occurs when a change is made to a related end.

public event System.ComponentModel.CollectionChangeEventHandler AssociationChanged;

Remarks

The AssociationChanged event is raised by the following methods:

  • Add
  • Remove
  • Load
  • Load
  • Attach
  • Clear

    Events may be suppressed during bulk operations, such as Load, Attach, and Clear.

Explicit Interface Implementations

IRelatedEnd.Add(IEntityWithRelationships)

Adds an object to the related end.

void IRelatedEnd.Add (System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityWithRelationships entity);
entity
IEntityWithRelationships

An object to add to the collection. This object must implement the IEntityWithRelationships interface.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the RelatedEnd instance is cast to an IRelatedEnd interface.

The IRelatedEnd.Add method is only maintained for compatibility with previous versions of the .NET Framework.

IRelatedEnd.Add(Object)

Adds an object to the related end.

void IRelatedEnd.Add (object entity);
entity
System.Object

An entity instance to add to the related end.

Remarks

If the source entity object is attached to a cache, then all the connected ends are added to the object cache and their corresponding relationships are also added to the ObjectStateManager. The RelatedEnd of the relationship is also fixed.

IRelatedEnd.Attach(IEntityWithRelationships)

Attaches an object at the related end.

void IRelatedEnd.Attach (System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityWithRelationships entity);
entity
IEntityWithRelationships

The object being attached.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the RelatedEnd instance is cast to an IRelatedEnd interface.

The IRelatedEnd.Attach method is only maintained for compatibility with previous versions of the .NET Framework.

IRelatedEnd.Attach(Object)

Attaches an object to the related end.

void IRelatedEnd.Attach (object entity);
entity
System.Object

An entity instance to attach to the related end.

Remarks

If the related end already has some entities attached to it, the existing entities will be merged with the new entity. The new entity is not assumed to be the complete set of related entity objects.

The source entity object and all entity objects passed in must be in an EntityState or EntityState state. Deleted elements are allowed only when the state manager is already tracking the relationship instance.

IRelatedEnd.CreateSourceQuery()

Returns an IEnumerable that represents the objects that belong to the related end.

System.Collections.IEnumerable IRelatedEnd.CreateSourceQuery ();
Returns
IEnumerable

An IEnumerable that represents the objects that belong to the related end.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the RelatedEnd instance is cast to an IRelatedEnd interface.

EntityCollection<TEntity> and EntityReference<TEntity> both override IRelatedEnd.CreateSourceQuery to return an ObjectQuery<T>. This query, when it is executed, returns the same set of objects that belong to the related end.

IRelatedEnd.Remove(IEntityWithRelationships)

Removes an object from the collection at the related end.

bool IRelatedEnd.Remove (System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityWithRelationships entity);
entity
IEntityWithRelationships

The entity instance to remove from the collection.

Returns
Boolean

A value that indicates whether the object was removed.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the RelatedEnd instance is cast to an IRelatedEnd interface.

The IRelatedEnd.Remove method is only maintained for compatibility with previous versions of the .NET Framework.

IRelatedEnd.Remove(Object)

Removes an object from the related end if the object is part of the related end.

bool IRelatedEnd.Remove (object entity);
entity
System.Object

An entity instance to remove from the related end.

Returns
Boolean

true if the entity was successfully removed; otherwise, false.

Remarks

If the source entity object is attached to a cache, the relationship is marked for deletion.
